reviews.review_msg: David is one of the best professors I have had in my time at SFU. He has a real passion for health psychology and really cares about teaching the material to his students. 3 exams which are a walk in the park if you come to the lecture and read the textbook (which is what being a student requires). I wish I could take every course with David.

Prof Cox is a wonderful story teller and he is really passionate about health psychology. Majority of the grades comes from the exams (I believe 95% exam, 5% participation). His exams are based on MCQ and Short Answers. Read the textbook and the lecture, and pay attention in class as some stories he tells are testable.

In general the course was divided into 3 exams, two midterms and one final, and a participation mark in the form of a question presented in class and submitted online. Prof can be real boring at times, and goes on long stories for examples. Read the textbook several times and you will be fine. Some questions in exams come from in-class material

Passionate teacher, very personable. David seems like he really enjoys teaching about health psych. As in any other class, read the book and study the ppt slides for the exams and you'll do fine, he's a fair prof. Wish there were more genuine teachers like David at SFU.

Really enjoyed him as a prof, while his lectures are not necessary-I suggest seeing him in office hours, he is very interesting and knowledgable. Tests are heavily based on the textbook, show up to class, if anything, just to ask him questions. No papers, just exams. I would take a class with him again in a second.

So much reading, you won't pass unless you read the book because most of what is on the test is taken from book. No assignments just tests. Lectures are BORING repeats same stories over and over. He's a nice guy but just so boring lol You can get a good mark by just reading test book, I skipped half the semester and got a B.
Read the book memorize word by word if you're aiming an A

This class was a lot of work. I hated waking up at 6 am to go to an 8:30 class, but I never did regret going to this one. David is super engaging, passionate and knowledgeable about health psychology. I got an A in this class, and my advice is be prepared to memorize a lot. It's tough, but doable!
There are only midterms and finals but the exams are hard. You have to carefully read the text in detail and memorize all the terms.

very entertaining and enthousiastic teacher! Lectures were very informative, except he sometimes goes off topic!  lots of reading and you have to know your textbook to do well in exams. but if you are interested in the field of health psychology go for it
